last_episode_to_air.name: Fermentation Man
last_episode_to_air.overview: When civilization crumbles, who ya gonna call to help get good eats on the table? Lactic acid bacteria, of course.

name: Good Eats
overview: Host Alton Brown explores the origins of ingredients, decodes culinary customs and presents food and equipment trends. Punctuated by unusual interludes, simple preparations and unconventional discussions, he'll bring you food in its finest and funniest form.

episodes.name: Steak Your Claim
episodes.overview:
Host Alton Brown journeys from field to market to hardware store in search of the perfect steak and the perfect pan to sear it in

.

Recipes featured on episode: Pan Seared Rib Eye.

episodes.name: This Spud's For You
episodes.overview:
Alton Brown ponders the potato and its main ingredient: Starch. Baking, mashing and gratins are re-examined.

Recipes: 

 Mashers 

 Potato/Portobello Gratin 

 The Baked Potato

episodes.name: The Egg-Files
episodes.overview:
Alton Brown cracks the mysterious egg case and pursues a higher understanding of the amazing ovoid's culinary powers. How to land a non-stick pan, scramble, over easy--and consider eggs for dessert

Recipes:  

 Lemon Curd 

 Scrambled Eggs Unscrambled

episodes.name: Salad Daze
episodes.overview:
Exiled to bars, chopped and pre-packaged, drenched in noxious concoctions, the tossed salad deserves better. Alton Brown goes back to salad basics and pays homage to Caesar.

Recipes:  

 Hail Caesar Salad 

 Veni Vedi Vinaigrette

episodes.name: A Bird in the Pan
episodes.overview:
Why did the chicken cross the road? Probably to escape Alton Brown, who seems intent on defining the perfect broiled chicken that's out of the oven and bathed in sauce in under half an hour.

Recipes : Broiled, Butterflied Chicken

episodes.name: Churn Baby Churn
episodes.overview:
You scream, I scream, but Alton Brown would rather make his own ice cream...and sorbet and granita. Secrets the pros don't want you to know and how to find an ice cream machine that delivers the goods without breaking the bank.

Recipes:  

 Serious Vanilla Ice Cream 

 Coffee Granita 

 Key Lime Sorbet

episodes.name: The Dough Also Rises
episodes.overview:
Searching for the perfect southern-style biscuit, Alton Brown investigates flour and leaveners and turns to his Grandmother for a pointer or two...not to mention a few pointed comments.

Recipes:  

 Scones 

 Shortcake 

 Southern Biscuits

episodes.name: Gravy Confidential
episodes.overview:
Host Alton Brown conquers ""rouxs"" and leads the way to lump free gravy.

Recipes:  

 Gravy from Roast Drippings 

 Sawmill Gravy 

 White Roux

episodes.name: A Bowl of Onion
episodes.overview:
Host Alton Brown journeys to the center of the onion. After rediscovering a kitchen classic, and debunking the mythology of tear-free onion cutting, he emerges with a darned fine bowl of soup.

Recipes: French Onion Soup

episodes.name: Hook, Line and Dinner
episodes.overview:
Alton Brown dives deep into the watery world of fish and finds that with just three cooking methods under your belt, you can cook just about all of the critters.

Recipes:  

 Grilled Salmon Steaks 

 Pan Fried Fish 

 Striped Bass in Salt Dome

episodes.name: Pantry Raid I: Use Your Noodle
episodes.overview:
Part one of an ongoing series looks at the king of pantry essentials: Dried pasta. Alton Brown explores pasta styles, the best cooking method (water is key), the tools you really need (big), and a different way of saucing.

Recipes: Pasta

episodes.name: Power to the Pilaf
episodes.overview:
Alton brown heads to LA for a sack of rice, evaluates rice cookers, unlocks saffron and rewrites the rules for the most versatile of all rice dishes: pilaf.

Recipes: Rice Pilaf

episodes.name: The Art of Darkness
episodes.overview:
Alton Brown delves into the dark world of chocolate, picks a pod, roasts some beans, questions mysterious guests, visits his shrink, makes a mousse and hits upon the ultimate chocolate recipe.

Recipes : 

 Chocolate Mousse 

 Chocolate Lava Muffins

episodes.name: It's a Wonderful Cake
episodes.overview: Alton Brown is out to prove that fruitcake shouldn't be the butt of holiday jokes any longer.

episodes.name: For Whom the Cheese Melts
episodes.overview: See what fondue has to do with football, make the best grilled cheese sandwich you have ever had and see why cheese is milk's leap to immortality.

episodes.name: Apple Family Values
episodes.overview: Watch Alton Brown show you how to shop, store, and prepare some apple classics.

episodes.name: Crustacean Nation
episodes.overview: Shrimp cocktail is not just for wedding receptions anymore.

episodes.name: The Fungal Gourmet
episodes.overview: Mushrooms are mysterious no longer, Alton makes them a kitchen staple.

episodes.name: Crust Never Sleeps
episodes.overview: Watch as Alton Brown creats the pie crust of his dreams.

episodes.name: True Brew
episodes.overview: Watch as Alton leads us through the history and prep of our favorite bean.

episodes.name: A Grind is a Terrible Thing to Waste
episodes.overview: Learn to be excited when meat loaf is for dinner...

episodes.name: Fry Hard
episodes.overview: Alton wants to show that proper know-how allows everyone to make healthy, delicious and safe fried foods.

episodes.name: Urban Preservation I: Jam Session
episodes.overview: Using good science and easy methods, Alton will show you how to jam.

episodes.name: Pantry Raid II: Seeing Red
episodes.overview: Need a tomato sauce?

episodes.name: Citizen Cane
episodes.overview: Desserts don't need to be difficult to create, and Alton is out to prove it.

episodes.name: Pork Fiction
episodes.overview: Just how difficult is it to create finger-licking ribs?

episodes.name: Ear Apparent
episodes.overview: Alton shops, shucks and shares the history and methods of the summer fave: corn.

episodes.name: American Pickle
episodes.overview: There is no good reason that people do not make their own pickles. They are easy and delicious. Let Alton show you simple joys of pickling.

episodes.name: Mussel Bound
episodes.overview: Alton explains the simple pleasures of mussels.

episodes.name: The Egg Files II: Man With a Flan
episodes.overview: AB, in his second egg show, is out to show eggs don't have to be scrambled or an omlet.

episodes.name: What's Up, Duck?
episodes.overview: Watch as Alton proves to us Americans that Duck can be a regular dish.

episodes.name: Behind the Bird
episodes.overview: AB is out to show you can make a great meal with Thanksgiving leftovers.

episodes.name: Three Chips for Sister Marsha
episodes.overview: Alton uses time travel to explain the mystery behind cookies with three kinds: the thin, the puffy and the chewy.

episodes.name: Flap Jack Do It Again
episodes.overview: Great pancakes (flapjacks) don't have to come from a box...

episodes.name: The Case for Butter
episodes.overview: AB goes to court to defend butter against its bad wrap.

episodes.name: Flat Is Beautiful
episodes.overview: AB claims we won't be satisfied with pizza until we take matters into our own hands.

episodes.name: Pantry Raid III: Cool Beans
episodes.overview: AB takes us through what it takes to turn beans into a great meal.

episodes.name: Mission: Poachable
episodes.overview: Alton must pit his poaching skills against those of the evil ""Frenchman"".

episodes.name: Tofuworld
episodes.overview: Alton makes what once seemed foreign into an understandable all American classic.

episodes.name: Head Games
episodes.overview: Alton Brown gets inside a cabbage's head and comes out with a better understanding of what makes this potentially troublesome vegetable tick.

episodes.name: Grill Seekers
episodes.overview: Watch as AB shows the grill can be a great tool in making a great meal.

episodes.name: Where There's Smoke, There's Fish
episodes.overview: Get the lowdown on wood chips and creating a simple smoker for fish.

episodes.name: Pressure
episodes.overview: The scientific theory behind capturing meaty goodness in liquid form and why the pressure cooker makes great broth.

episodes.name: Fry Hard II: The Chicken
episodes.overview:
AB pan-fries a chicken, also showing how to butcher it into perfect pieces.

Buttermilk bathed, golden brown and deliciousmmm, mmm, fry some more, 'cause nobody doesn't love fried chicken.

episodes.name: Crustacean Nation II: Claws
episodes.overview: Host Alton Brown demystifies the buying, handling and cooking of the briny bug that put the surf into the surf-n-turf.

episodes.name: Ham I Am
episodes.overview: Country and city hams: cured, smoked, raw, brined or fresh, get your juices going for some good old American ham.

episodes.name: Let Them Eat Foam
episodes.overview: Chocolate layer and sheet cakes are more American than apple pie, yet few of us ever bake them anymore. We're going to change all that. Shop for cake pans, learn everything you need to know to keep your foam from flopping and produce a heavenly cake.

episodes.name: A Chuck for Chuck
episodes.overview: From ordinary chuck to sublime, melt in your mouth flavor: how to make the perfect pot roast without the pot.

episodes.name: Pantry Raid IV: Comb Alone
episodes.overview: The most mentioned food in the Bible; The only food produced for us by animals. It's a sweetener, it's an antiseptic, it's amazing.

episodes.name: The Bulb of the Night
episodes.overview: Meet the Count and discover the miraculous properties of Garlic.

episodes.name: Mayo Clinic
episodes.overview: Join Alton Brown as he debunks the many mysteries of mayonnaise.

episodes.name: Puff the Magic Pastry
episodes.overview: Don't be afraid, the store stuff can deliver the puff.

episodes.name: True Brew II: Mr Tea
episodes.overview: Tea is the second most popular beverage, so let's brew some.

episodes.name: Chile's Angels
episodes.overview: Alton investigates the fruity heat of chilies and that ubiquitous condiment: salsa.

episodes.name: Deep Space Slime
episodes.overview:
Alton is working as a consultant on a low budget sci-fi movie. His job: make spooky, gooey gelatin molds. Since gelatin is one of the most powerful tools on the pantry planet, Alton's happy to comply, but he insists on making it taste real good.

Recipes:  

 Panna Cotta Brain with Cranberry Glaze 

 Spooky Edible Eyes 

 Sparkling Gingered Face 

 Cinnamon Cherry Heart

episodes.name: Oat Cuisine
episodes.overview:
Following a heart attack and near death experience, Alton takes Gods advice and gets seriously into oatmeal. Examine crock pots, make honest granola, learn about fiber & nutrition and make the universal baked dessert topping.

Recipes:  

 Granola 

 Overnight Oatmeal 

 Steel Cut Oatmeal 

 Haggis

episodes.name: Crepe Expectations
episodes.overview:
Crepes are a great wrap with a bad rap. Truth is, crepes are incredibly simple, versatile, and good eats. All you need is science, a good pan, and a limber wrist. Alton performs crepe technique for a live audience.

Recipes : 

 Crepes 

 Crepe Quiche Lorraine 

 Crepes Suzette 

 Mushroom Crepe Cake

episodes.name: Celebrity Roast
episodes.overview:
As the holidays approach Alton Brown ponders the perfect roast beast, meets with a butcher, comes to terms with aging, learns about ovens & radiant heat, discovers new ways to have fun with flower pots, and produces the ultimate carnivores delight.

Recipes:

 Dry-Aged Standing Rib Roast with Sage Jus

episodes.name: Scrap Iron Chef
episodes.overview:
Alton Brown finds himself participating in a rather odd TV game show. The arena: a junkyard. The opponent: Chef Midwest. The ingredient: pork belly.

Recipes:  

 Bacon Vinaigrette with Grilled Radicchio 

 Scrap Iron Chef's Bacon 

 Honey Mustard Cure 

 Molasses Black Pepper Cure 

 Red Pepper Brine 

 Soy Honey Brine

episodes.name: Berry From Another Planet
episodes.overview:
The aliens among us are eggplants and they are delicious?really. Learn to shop for and store different varieties of eggplant, evaluate bread crumbs, and celebrate the vegetable peeler.

Recipes:  

 Baba Ghannouj 

 Eggplant Pasta 

 Eggplant Steaks

episodes.name: The Trouble with Cheesecake
episodes.overview:
Alton helps discover the secrets of cream cheese and its alter-ego marscapone. Conquer crumb crusts, buy into some pans, and produce both savory and sweet cheesecakes without a crack in site.

Recipes:  

 Savory Cheesecake 

 Sour Cream Cheesecake

episodes.name: Squid Pro Quo
episodes.overview:
Alton finds himself catering a tailgate party for a group of folks out to catch a glimpse of a mythical sea monster.To commemorate the event, Alton prepares a menu featuring his favorite tailgateable sea monster: squid.

Recipes:  

 Squid Vicious

episodes.name: Art of Darkness II: Cocoa
episodes.overview:
Alton gets the dirt on Dutch processing and the dead Dutch guy who invented it, choose a few powders then apply them to hot chocolate, brownies, sorbet and homemade chocolate syrup.

Recipes:  

 Cocoa Brownies 

 Hot Cocoa 

 Cocoa Syrup

episodes.name: Squash Court
episodes.overview:
Hard or "winter" squashes confuse and confound for no other reason than there are so darned many of them. Learn how to shop, store, and cook a plethora of gourdy recipes, find out what's really up with beta carotene and why you need to buy a stick blender.

Recipes:  

 Butternut Dumplings with Brown Butter and Sage 

 Pumpkin Bread 

 Squash Soup

episodes.name: For Whom the Cheese Melts II
episodes.overview:
Learn what you can do to return Macaroni & Cheese to a table near you. Evaluate bakeware, noodle noodles, look into evaporated milk and of course?cheddar cheese.

Recipes:  

 Baked Macaroni and Cheese 

 Stove Top Mac-n-Cheese 

 Next Day Mac and Cheese "Toast"

episodes.name: Send in the Clams
episodes.overview:
No bivalve is more American than the clam nor is any other shell-dweller more versatile in the kitchen. Learn the ins and outs of clam identification, decide which ones to use where, buy a clam opening device and make a wicked chowder.

Recipes: 

 Radonsky for the New Millenium 

 Clams on the Half Shell with Fresh Mayonnaise 

 Clam Chowder

episodes.name: This Spud's for You Too
episodes.overview:
Alton, ever the Spud Stud, cooks up homey Potato Soup, creamy Potato Salad and a spectacular Swiss Rosti.

Recipes:  

 Leftover Baked Potato Soup 

 Cold-Fashioned Potato Salad 

 Potato Roesti

episodes.name: The Other Red Meat
episodes.overview:
A quick trip to the afterlife convinces host Alton Brown to get serious about eating more tuna. Find out how to grill on a chimney charcoal starter, how to avoid fake soy sauce, and why you can see a rainbow on Tuna Steaks.

Recipes:

 Chimney Tuna Loin

episodes.name: Strawberry Sky
episodes.overview:
Join Host Alton Brown to learn how to make the most of strawberry season. You can macerate them, glaze them, freeze them with dry ice, and even build a summer pudding in a tin can. AB even holds a quick lesson on the power of antioxidants.

Recipes:  

 Clotted Cream 

 Macerated Strawberries 

 Strawberry Pudding 

 Frozen Strawberries 

 Clotted Cream 

 Macerated Strawberries 

 Strawberry Pudding 

 Frozen Strawberries

episodes.name: Artichokes: The Choke is On You
episodes.overview:
Host Alton Brown gets to the heart of artichokes. Pick up tips on storing, prepping, cooking and even eating this giant flower bud, as well as how to make your own herb oil to marinate them in.

Recipes:  

 Artichoke Pasta Salad 

 Broiled Chokes 

 Herb Oil

episodes.name: Good Milk Gone Bad
episodes.overview:
Yogurt's not just good for you, it's just plain good. Especially when you make your own. Host Alton Brown shows how easy this miraculous feat really is, then demonstrates plenty of ways to use the white stuff up.

Recipes :

 Fresh Yogurt 

 Lemon-Ginger Frozen Yogurt 

 Tarragon Yogurt Sauce 

 Thousand Island Dressing 

 Herb Spread 

 Yogurt Cheese

episodes.name: Egg Files V: Quantum Foam
episodes.overview:
The word "souffle" has instilled fear in cooks for ages. Host Alton Brown believes a strong dose of science is all that's needed to get control of your egg foam. Learn the ins and outs of the cheese souffle, and how to manage the heat in your oven.

Recipes:

 Cheese Souffle

episodes.name: Tomato Envy
episodes.overview:
Learn everything you need to know about making the best use of the biggest berry to ever be called a vegetable. Take a serious look at serrated knives, a strange and delicious sandwich and a tomato sauce that almost isn't.

Recipes:  

 Stuffed Tomatoes 

 Tomato Sauce 

 TBL Panzanella

episodes.name: Amber Waves
episodes.overview:
Join Host Alton Brown and learn everything you need to know about yeast, barley, hops and the hardware you need to bring them together to produce that most American of foods, Beer.

Recipes:

 Good Brew

episodes.name: Dip Madness
episodes.overview:
Dips may have driven Alton Brown a little bonkers but that won't keep him from delivering the goods on guacamole, California dip and the unjustly dissed chicken liver mousse.

Recipes:  

 Chicken Liver Mousse 

 Guacamole 

 Hot Spinach and Artichoke Dip 

 Onion Dip from Scratch

episodes.name: Chops Ahoy
episodes.overview:
Host Alton Brown yearns for the juicy chop of yesterdayand he intends to get it. Visit the neighborhood butcher, pick up stuffing tips (no, stuffing is not evil) and learn more than you ever wanted to know about propane.

Recipes:

 Stuffed Grilled Pork Chops

episodes.name: Choux Shine
episodes.overview:
The easiest pastry dough to make also happens to be the most versatile and delicious. Trouble is, Americans won's make it because it's got a scary name:pate a choux. Join host Alton Brown as he takes the steamy dough from cream puff to eclair and beyond. 

Recipes:  

 Funnel Cake 

 Sweet or Savory Pate a Choux

episodes.name: Casserole Over
episodes.overview:
When a Sunday drive goes bad, host Alton Brown finds himself pushing the limits of his casserole knowledge to free his dog from angry church ladies.

Recipes:  

 Broccoli Casserole 

 Curry Chicken Pot Pie 

 Garlic Shrimp Casserole

episodes.name: Use Your Noodle II
episodes.overview:
Stuffed pastas like Ravioli are much loved but seldom made. Host Alton Brown intends to put that to an end by demystifying noodle and filling alike.The answer: Your ironing board.

Recipes:  

 Ravioli 

 Tortellini

episodes.name: Salad Daze II: The Long Arm of the Slaw
episodes.overview:
Alton Brown's slaw-centric guest slot on a popular morning talk show turns into a strange and wonderful half hour of good eats.

Recipes:  

 Marinated Slaw 

 Asian Slaw 

 Beet Slaw 

 Coleslaw

episodes.name: A Cake on Every Plate
episodes.overview:
Host Alton Brown finds a challenge in his mail box: decipher a deceased family baker's famous yellow cake.

Recipes:  

 Cocoa Whipped Cream 

 Gold Cake

episodes.name: The Icing Man Cometh
episodes.overview:
Cake is dandy but let's face it, without frosting it's just sweet bread (not sweetbreads). Host Alton Brown builds a better butter cream then builds a layer cake from ground up...with tools from his local hardware. 

Recipes:  

 Buttercream 

 Ganache 

 Writing Chocolate

episodes.name: Beet It
episodes.overview:
Long feared by baby boomers accustomed to being accosted by noxious red wedges, beets are good eats, or so says host Alton Brown who suggests one approach the ruby roots with an open mind and a good pair of gloves.

Recipes:  

 Beet Green Gratin 

 Glazed Baby Beets 

 Pickled Beets

episodes.name: Fit to Be Tied
episodes.overview:
Since childhood, host Alton Brown's had a soft spot in his appetite for roulades, savory rolls of meaty goodness that look hard... but aren't...as long as you've got science on your side.

Recipes:  

 Braciole 

 Fish Roll with Compound Butter

episodes.name: Crustacean Nation III: Feeling Crabby
episodes.overview:
What do you do when your live crab runs away from home? If you're Alton Brown you turn to frozen legs and other packaged products. A cop out? Nope, good eats.

Recipes:  

 Steamed Alaskan King Crab Claws 

 Ghee 

 Crab Cakes or Fritters 

 Marinated Crab Salad

episodes.name: Q
episodes.overview:
Host Alton Brown thinks he's cracked the code to true 'cue: brined pork, a flower pot, a trashcan, hardwood smoke and a lot of patience.

Recipes : Pulled Pork

episodes.name: The Egg Files VI: French Flop
episodes.overview:
Alternative name: Zen and the Art of Omelet Maintenance

Host Alton Brown gets Zen with the simply delicious yet simply misunderstood king of egg applications.

Recipes:  

 Omelet 

 Omelet for a Crowd 

 Frittata

episodes.name: The Muffin Man
episodes.overview:
America's favorite breakfast bread moved out of the home kitchen long ago. With the help of some sound science and an incarcerated brother, host Alton Brown plans to change all that.

Recipes:  

 Blueberry Muffins  

 English Muffins

episodes.name: True Brew IV: Take Stock
episodes.overview:
Some folks may think of home made stocks as culinary anachronisms, but host Alton Brown thinks they're the best edible investment in town. Follow him as he buys the perfect stock pot and brews up some chickeney goodness spiced up with a tasty jolt of science and major dose of practical advice.

Recipes: 

 Chicken Stock 

 Chicken Noodle Soup

episodes.name: Sausage: A Beautiful Grind
episodes.overview:
Host Alton Brown thinks that sausage should be our national dish. Never made your own? Once you know how easy it is, you will. Take a look at grinders, the perfect hunk of pork and the longest piece of protein in the world. 

Recipes : 

 Breakfast Sausage  

 Italian Sausage

episodes.name: Raising the Steaks
episodes.overview:
Host Alton Brown returns to the scene of episode #1 to re-think the great American steak.

Recipes : 

 Sirloin Steak 

 Skirt Steak

episodes.name: The Pouch Principle
episodes.overview:
Living fast often means getting your food from a bag. Host Alton Brown doesn't see anything wrong with that as long as the bag comes out of your oven or microwave. Pouch cookery may have ancient origins but it may just be the key to your future food. 

Recipes : 

 Ramen Shrimp Pouch 

 Red Snapper en Papillote 

 Salmon Fillet en Papillote with Julienne Vegetable 

 Stone Fruit Pouches 

 Vanilla Sugar

episodes.name: Ill Gotten Grains
episodes.overview:
Wheat berries, bulgur, and couscous aren't your usual wheaty fare but then you don't see a lot of food shows featuring amnesia or kidnapping either. 

Recipes:  

 Bulgur Gazpacho 

 Wheat Berry Tapanade 

 Mushroom Wheat Berry Pilaf 

 Steamed Couscous 

 Basic Cooked Wheat Berries 

 Cherry Couscous Pudding

episodes.name: Tricks for Treats
episodes.overview:
Despite the fact that Americans spend billions a year on manufactured treats, truth is, great candy starts in the home. Join host Alton Brown as he explains the trick to treats like taffy, brittles, and jellies.

Recipes:  

 Chocolate Taffy 

 Acid Jellies 

 Peanut Brittle

episodes.name: Potato, My Sweet
episodes.overview:
Long typecast as a character actor on the culinary stage, this longsuffering root is finally ready for a star role, and it's not in Silence of the Yams.

Recipes :

 Sweet Potato Waffles 

 Sweet Potato Pie 

 Chipotle Smashed Sweet Potatoes

episodes.name: The Cookie Clause
episodes.overview:
Santa Claus is coming to town, and unless Alton Brown can bake up the perfect holiday cookie he's going to find himself on the wrong end of the big guy's list. Join AB for an evening of cookie baking basics, frosting food science, and maybe a little reindeer wrangling.

Recipes:  

 Sugar Cookies 

 Royal Icing 

 Chocolate Peppermint Pinwheel Cookies

episodes.name: Herbal Preservation
episodes.overview:
Where ""Spice Trade"" took on the seeds, bark, berries and fruits we grind onto our foods, this show focuses on the wide range of greenery that can add depth and dimension that make Good Eats better. Plus, learn how to set up your own container herb garden.

Recipes:  

 Tarragon Chive Vinegar 

 Parsley Salad

episodes.name: Spice Capades
episodes.overview:
A primer for buying, storing, mixing and matching, cooking and eating spices. Find the best tools for grinding them, learn what they are, where they come from and how they shaped the modern world.

Recipes : 

 Broiled Salmon with AB's Spice Pomade 

 Vegetable Curry 

 Curry Powder Blend 

 Dried Pear and Fig Compote

episodes.name: The Man Food Show
episodes.overview:
Just in time for the big game, a show all about food best consumed in a lazy-boy: real, honest to goodness corn dogs and basket burgers (those little single bite burgers that are so darned good).

Recipes:  

 Corn Dogs 

 Mini Man Burgers

episodes.name: Fudge Factor
episodes.overview:
It turns out the secret to producing the archetypal American candy doesn't lie in the power of chocolate but in the power of crystals. Host Alton Brown helps you to grow your own.

Recipes:  

 Chocolate Fudge 

 Peanut Butter Fudge

episodes.name: Sometimes You Feel Like A Nut
episodes.overview:
Whether they're the main ingredient or a supporting player, nuts have needs?special needs if we're going to get the most out of them. Learn better ways to store, cook and cook with a variety of nuts, which turn out to be as good for you as they taste. 

Recipes:  

 Cashew Sauce 

 Pistachio Mixed Herb Pesto 

 Pistachio Fruit Balls 

 Macadamia Nut Crusted Mahi Mahi 

 Macadamia Nut Crust

episodes.name: I Pie
episodes.overview:
Alton Brown goes undercover for an in depth look at lemon meringue pie.

 Recipes:  

 Lemon Meringue Pie 

 Pie Crust

episodes.name: Toast Modern
episodes.overview:
Some of the world's greatest dishes...Bruschetta, French Toast, Welsh Rabbit to better croutons to your basic breakfast shingle, toast is an example of good eats that could usually be a whole lot better.

Recipes:  

 French Toast 

 Bruschetta 

 Welsh Rarebit

episodes.name: Top Banana
episodes.overview:
There's a lot more under that  peel than most folks think. Learn more about the many varieties  available in the US and how they like to be handled. Take a side trip  through plantains, learn how to make an amazingly fast banana bread and classic Bananas Foster... with fire and everything.

Recipes: 

 Banana Ice Cream 

 Banana's Foster 

 Fried Plantains

episodes.name: Hittin' the Sauce
episodes.overview:
With a few simple tools and some basic chemistry, host Alton Brown simplifies the most common sauce quandaries. Throw away your boxed preparations and find how simple it is to create an elegant hollandaise and peppercorn sauce for your favorite steak.

Recipes:  

 Strip Steak with Pepper Cream Sauce 

 Hollandaise

episodes.name: Shell Games
episodes.overview:
Oysters are a mystery to many and downright spooky to some. Join host Alton Brown as he unravels the secrets of this bivalve, cracks a safe or two and reinvents classic applications like oysters ""Rock-A-Fella.""

Recipes:  

 Baked Oysters Brownefeller 

 Horseradish Cream Sauce 

 Oyster Soup

episodes.name: Flat is Beautiful II
episodes.overview:
These days we're all looking for ways to make more out of less. Alton Brown's favorite strategy: flatten meats wafer thin and cover them with flavor. New looks at old classics like Chicken Kiev, Turkey Piccata and Carpaccio.

Recipes:  

 Beef Paillard 

 Chicken Kiev 

 Turkey Piccata

episodes.name: Circle of Life
episodes.overview:
Everybody loves donuts but nobody seems to make their own...until now. Join host Alton Brown as he delves into this country's favorite pastry. Not only will you learn how to make your own you'll find out how the donut really got its hole.

Recipes:  

 Yeast Doughnuts 

 Doughnut Glaze 

 Chocolate Doughnut Glaze

episodes.name: Wonton Ways
episodes.overview:
The humble wonton skin may look exotic but it's also the most versatile pasta you can invite into your kitchen. Join Alton Brown as he stuffs and folds and fries and steams and bakes up a mess of good eats out of this Chinese restaurant standard.

Recipes : 

 Perfect Potstickers 

 Vegetarian Steamed Dumplings 

 Pear Walnut Wontons

episodes.name: The Big Chili
episodes.overview:
Join Host and cowpoke Gerald P Hobbs (Alton Brown) and his sidekick Rusty as they rustle up a good, honest bowl of red. Along the way, they'll ponder the chili mythology, grind up their own chili powder (that's chili with an ""i"") and do some serious work under pressure.

Recipes:  

 AB's Chili Powder 

 Pressure Cooker Chili

episodes.name: Sandwich-craft
episodes.overview:
To some it's a couple of pieces of bread with something shoved between. To others, a sandwich is a sublime balance of flavor and texture born as much of technique as ingredient. Alton Brown and his nephew Elton dose up a little Sandwich-craft.

Recipes:  

 Cuban Sandwich 

 Pan Bagnat 

 Roasted Vegetable Spread

episodes.name: Soups On
episodes.overview:
A good soup is like a cooking school in a bowl and class is in session for host Alton Brown's nephew Elton. Join the two as they work together to craft an old classic and (perhaps) a new one.

Recipes:  

 Garden Vegetable Soup 

 Grape Gazpacho

episodes.name: Say Cheese
episodes.overview:
Join host Alton Brown for a collection of short films about his favorite food: cheese. Learn about everything from pasteurization to pairing, Lactose to graters. Learn how to make cheese into soup, crackers, and a spread to end all spreads.

Recipes:  

 Cheese Soup 

 Fromage Fort 

 Parmesan Crisps

episodes.name: Art of Darkness III
episodes.overview:
What could possibly be more chocolaty than chocolate? Join host Alton Brown as for his third journey into the world of chocolate.

Recipes:  

 Chocolate Truffles 

 Ganache Frosting 

 Good Eats Fudgepops

episodes.name: True Grits
episodes.overview:
Whether you're cooking up a mess of grits or a pot of polenta cornmeal may just be the most powerful player in the pantry. Join host Alton Brown as he battles with cultural claims, doses up some science and cranks out an upside-down cake with a twist.

Recipes:  

 Cheese Grits 

 Savory Polenta 

 Pineapple Upside-Down Cornmeal Cake

episodes.name: Stuff It
episodes.overview:
AB's gone on record as saying the stuff is evil and yet, hundreds of protest letters have him rethinking his position. Can a stuffing be designed that's good for diner and bird alike?

Recipes  

 Stuffed Squash 

 Turkey with Stuffing

episodes.name: Puddin' Head Blues
episodes.overview:
In an effort to pay off the IRS, host Alton Brown decides to enter a pudding recipe contest being held by the TV pudding queen: Auntie Pudding. 

Recipes:  

 Indian Rice Pudding 

 Tapioca Pudding 

 Instant Chocolate Pudding Mix 

 Chocolate Pudding

episodes.name: Melondrama
episodes.overview:
Join host Alton Brown as he attempts to demystify one of the most complex and promising fruits around.

Recipes : 

 Hot Melon Salad 

 Melon Sorbet

episodes.name: Myth Smashers
episodes.overview: Join host Alton Brown as he sears meat, washes mushrooms, oils the pasta water and tries to blow-up water.

episodes.name: Cuckoo for Coq Au Vin
episodes.overview:
Can a fussy French fricassee fit a modern American lifestyle? Sure. All it takes is a chicken, a couple bottles of wine and a little know-how. The fussy French part is purely optional.

Recipes:  Coq au Vin

episodes.name: Carrots: A Taproot Orange
episodes.overview:
Theyre long, theyre orange and theyre everywhere, but do we ever really think about carrots? Host Alton Brown does?a lot. Join him as he concocts everything from salads to cakes and explains the whole carrot/vision thing. 

Recipes:  

 Carrot Slaw 

 Glazed Carrots 

 Carrot Cake

episodes.name: Sprung a Leek
episodes.overview:
Host Alton Brown ponders the leek, the lesser-known member of the Allium family which it turns, can do anything its siblings can do, only better. Don't believe it? Try these onion rings.

Recipes:  

 Grilled Braised Leeks 

 Leek Rings 

 Leek Potato Soup

episodes.name: Dr. Strangeloaf
episodes.overview:
Tune in as Alton shows us how to create a great loaf of bread.

Recipes: Very Basic Bread

episodes.name: My Big Fat Greek Sandwich
episodes.overview:
The gyro may just be the perfect sandwich. Too bad you can't make one at home.or can you? Join host Alton Brown as he tackles rotisseries, tzatziki sauce and a pile of broken plates. 

Recipes : Gyro Meat with Tzatziki Sauce

episodes.name: Field of Greens
episodes.overview:
Was your childhood eating plagued with plate-loads of slimy, foul-smelling leaves? Host Alton Brown shows how to turn fiend to friend when he takes on dark leafy greens. Tune in and you might learn a thing or two about nutrition too. 

Recipes:  

 Mustard Green Gratin 

 Pot O'Greens 

 Lemon Sesame Glazed Greens

episodes.name: Do The Rice Thing
episodes.overview:
To most Americans rice means long grain, white grains. But we're missing out on the marvels of short, medium and brown grains. Join host Alton Brown as he stirs up a risotto, makes a rice salad and delves deep into a mixed bag of starch. 

Recipes:  

 Baked Brown Rice 

 Brown Rice Salad 

 Wild Mushroom and Asparagus Risotto

episodes.name: Give Peas a Chance
episodes.overview:
AB is called to a normal, suburban house one night to ""treat"" a boy who, having been told that he can't leave the table until he eats his peas, hasn't left the table for a very long time.

Recipes featured in the episode:

Green Peas with Cheese and Herbs, Split Pea Burgers, and Curried Split Pea Soup.

This episode was the first of the season and ushered in a new set of cameras.  Alton and the crew played with the camera with one episode last season, and we got to see the different cameras from shot to shot.  It now looks as though they're only going to be using the new cameras, which result in a different picture.

episodes.name: Dis-Kabob-Ulated
episodes.overview:
Does the kabob still have a roll to play in the modern culinary carnival? Sure it does. You just need the right ingredients, the right skewers, the right heat and the right mindset.

Recipes featured on this episode: Spicy Beef Kebabs and Vanilla Lime Pineapple Skewers.

episodes.name: Urban Preservation II: The Jerky
episodes.overview:
Alton Brown takes us on a tour of beef jerky from its ancient beginnings to shopping for it, making it, and cooking with it.

Recipes featured in this episode: 

Beef Jerky.

 Jerky Tomato Sauce

episodes.name: Churn Baby Churn, 2
episodes.overview: AB sets out to figure out how to make ice cream himself. After a visit from some federal ice cream agents and a little investigation of ingredients, AB cracks the code. Recipes include: Chocolate Ice Cream, Vanilla Ice Cream, Mint Chip Ice Cream.

episodes.name: Power Trip
episodes.overview:
AB looks at the nutritional challenges then concocts a protein bar, an ""energy"" bar, and a very healthy puffed rice treat that is also ""crispy"".

Recipes  

 Brown Rice Crispy Bar  

 Granola Bars 

 Protein Bars

episodes.name: Wake Up Little Sushi
episodes.overview:
AB investigates the ins and outs of ordering, eating, shopping for and even making basic sushi. Plenty of history thrown in for good measure. Remember, in Sushiworld nothing can go wrong!

Recipes  

 Sushi Rice 

 California Roll

episodes.name: Cobbled Together
episodes.overview:
After years of applying, AB is finally getting a shot to join the prestigious Institute for the Preservation of Culinary Heritage and Authenticity. All he has to do to get in is prepare a dessert for a special dinner.

Recipes  

 Rhubarb Peach Cobbler 

 Blackberry Grunt 

 Individual Berry Crisps

episodes.name: Good Wine Gone Bad
episodes.overview:
Join host Alton Brown as he dives deep into the pantry to investigate the many facets of vinegar.

Recipes: 

 Grilled Romaine 

 Sauerbraten

episodes.name: The Waffle Truth
episodes.overview:
Alton Brown dresses up as the ""Waffler"" and rids the neighborhood of pathetic commercial frozen waffles, and then shows how to make your very own.

Recipes  

 Basic Waffle 

 Chocolate Waffle

episodes.name: Great Balls of Meat
episodes.overview:
Alton explains how to make meatballs, with two examples: baked meatballs, and Swedish meatballs.

Recipes  

 Baked Meatballs 

 Swedish Meatballs

episodes.name: Curious Yet Tasty Avocado Experiment
episodes.overview:
Alton studies the avocado and discovers some surprising avocado treats.

Recipes featured: Avocado Compound Butter, Avocado Ice Cream, Avocado Buttercream Frosting

episodes.name: A Pie in Every Pocket
episodes.overview:
Join host Alton Brown as he looks into the past, future and present of the very handy ""pocket"" pie.

Recipes featured in this episode: Pocket Pie

episodes.name: School of Hard Nogs
episodes.overview:
Alton Brown reviews the history of egg nog, and comes up with several variations on the theme. He also investigates how bourbon is made.

Recipes:  

 Eggnog 

 Eggnog Ice Cream

episodes.name: My Pod
episodes.overview:
Alton takes a look at the vanilla bean/pod.

Recipes : 

 Creme Brulee 

 Fruit Salad with Vanilla Dressing 

 Vanilla Poached Pears

episodes.name: Tender is the Loin 1
episodes.overview:
Alton looks at the one of the single best (and most expensive) cuts of meat, the tenderloin.

Recipes featured in this episode: Steak au Poivre

episodes.name: Raising The Bar
episodes.overview:
Alton looks at the basics of what makes up a bar and prepares a few drinks.

Recipes featured in this episode: Daiquiri, AB's Martini, and Mint Julep.

episodes.name: Tender Is the Loin 2
episodes.overview:
Alton takes another look at the one of the single best (and most expensive) cuts of meat, the tenderloin.

Recipes featured in this episode: Center Cut Tenderloin Roast, Chain of Bull Cheese Steaks. Beef Carpaccio, and Stuffed Tenderloin.

episodes.name: Flat is Beautiful III - Flounder
episodes.overview:
Join Alton as he creates dishes suited specifically for the flounder

Recipes featured in this episode:

Baked Stuffed Flounder,

Oil Poached Flounder

Flounder Fish Salad.

episodes.name: Your Pad or Mine (Thai)
episodes.overview:
AB sets out to try to make some great Thai stir fry with common ingredients.

Recipes featured in this episode: Pad Thai

episodes.name: Shell Game IV (Scallops)
episodes.overview:
Alton sets his sights on Maine in hopes of finding a monster scallop.

Recipes: 

 Seared Scallops 

 Scallops on the Half Shell 

 Scallop Mousse

episodes.name: Olive Me
episodes.overview:
Although small, olives pack a whallop in the taste department. Alton tries to prove martinis aren't the place olives can be used.

Recipes:  

 Citrus Marinated Olives 

 Tapenade 

 Olive Loaf

episodes.name: Behind The Eats
episodes.overview: If you're a Good Eats fan, you've seen Alton do it all. Although hard to believe, he does have some help when it comes to creating each episode. Join us "Behind the Eats" as the Good Eats crew reveal their thrilling, compelling and sometimes hard to believe behind the scenes secrets.

episodes.name: Tort(illa) Reform
episodes.overview:
With so few Americans making their own tortillas, AB hopes to provide some simple tips and recipes to make a great tortilla, replacing the mediocre store-bought ones we have in our pantry.

Recipes featured in this episode: Corn Tortillas, Lime Tortilla Chips.

episodes.name: Just Barley
episodes.overview:
AB takes the handful of simple grains of barley and tries to turn them into a meal we could all love.

Recipes featured in this episode: Baked Barley, Barley Bread, Barley and Lamb Stew, Barley Salad, Barley Water.

episodes.name: House of the Rising Bun
episodes.overview:
Alton's trying to sell a house, but the realtor insists the delectable smell of baked goods can help make the sale, so it's off to the oven for Alton.

Recipes featured in this episode:

- Cinnamon Buns

- Citrus Ginger Ring

- Monkey Bread

episodes.name: Cubing a Round
episodes.overview:
Alton examines the history of the cube steak and tries to bring country cooking home again.

Recipes featured in this episode: Country Style Steak, Swiss Steak, Chicken Fried Steak.

episodes.name: Water Works I
episodes.overview: Alton explains the sources of drinking water, its properties and dangers, and the popularity of bottled water.

episodes.name: Water Works II
episodes.overview: Alton continues his exploration of water, explaining how home water filters remove contaminants, how water softeners work, and describes the attributes of water's other forms -- steam and ice.

episodes.name: Peachy Keen
episodes.overview:
Good Southern boy Alton takes on the South's favorite fruit, featuring its history, varieties and how to preserve the famously perishable flesh.

Recipes in this episode:

- Grilled Peach Melba

- Individual Peach Upside-Down Cake

episodes.name: Okraphobia
episodes.overview:
Sid the Edibles Agent returns, asking Alton to help redeem his latest problem client, the infamously slimy seedpod known as okra.

Recipes featured in this episode:

- Okra and Tomatoes

- Pickled Okra

- Wet Fried Okra

- Dry Fried Okra

episodes.name: Squid Pro Quo II
episodes.overview:
Alton takes to the sea on a research ship to learn more about squid and demonstrate recipes for squid appetizers.

Recipes in this episode:

- Dry Fried Calamari

- Wet Fried Calamari

- Seaside Squid Salad

- Squid Stuffed Squid

episodes.name: Pop Art
episodes.overview: A trip to a local cinema reminds Alton that popcorn was once light, fluffy and flavorful. Learn the how and why of exploding kernels and see Alton's improvised, inexpensive popcorn popper.

episodes.name: Major Pepper
episodes.overview:
Alton turns the spotlight on the king of spices, pepper, which has seen its once lofty stature reduced to being a companion for table salt. Included: A historical lesson tracing the spice empires of the 17th century and how to select pepper grinders.

Recipes in this episode:

- Pepper Deviled Eggs

- Black Pepper Mango Sorbet

- Slow Cooker Pepper Pork Chops

- Pepper Vodka

episodes.name: Fry Turkey Fry
episodes.overview:
Deep-frying a turkey is a cooking method growing in popularity by leaps and bounds. But it can also be one of the most dangerous, with potential for serious oil burns or even fire. Alton spotlights the essential steps for ultimate safety, including how to select the best frying kit and making the Alton Brown Turkey Derrick, his recommended way to get the bird in and out of the pot without putting yourself at risk.

Featured recipes in this episode:- Deep-fried Turkey

episodes.name: Pantry Raid VI: Lentils
episodes.overview:
Alton considers the lentil, a delicious source of protein, fiber and minerals that works in soups, in salads, and even in baked goods like cookies - yes, cookies! The sixth in an occasional series about the contents of the well-stocked pantry.

Recipes  

 Lentil Cookies 

 Lentil Salad 

 Lentil Soup

episodes.name: Tortillas Again
episodes.overview:
Alton is under siege. His kitchen is being picketed by Cooks Against Wasted Left-Overs. Alone and abandoned by his film crew, Alton is visited by the Mother of Culinary Invention, who gives the desperate cook inspiration.

Recipes in this episode:

- Enchilada Lasagna

- Masa Tots

- Ultimate Nachos

episodes.name: Bowl O' Bayou
episodes.overview:
AB breaks down the whole concept of Gumbo, clarifies the differences between Cajun and Creole and explains the importance of the roux this classic dish. After numerous roux failures AB comes up with a foolproof method for making a brick (dark) roux and the perfect gumbo.

Recipes:  

 Shrimp Gumbo

episodes.name: Fowl Territory
episodes.overview:
Cornish hens are small and delicious, but have the same dangers of their larger brethren. Alton gives a crash course on how to avoid illness with the tiny birds, featuring his Four Cs of food safety: Contain, Clean, Cook and Chill.- 

Recipies

- Grilled Curry Cornish Hens

- Cornish Game Hen with Bacon and Onions

episodes.name: Fruit 10 from Outer Space (Pomegranates)
episodes.overview:
The pomegranate looks like something from outer space, but Alton tells us that it's one of the healthiest fruits available. But only if you know how to get to the capsules of juicy goodness without making a mess.

Recipes in this episode:

- Pomegranate Syrup or Molasses

- Pomegranate Gelatin

- Grilled Leg of Lamb with Pomegranate Molasses Glaze

- Tequila Sunrise

episodes.name: Pickled Pink/Corn the Beef
episodes.overview:
Inspired by a trip to New York City, the capital of corned beef, Alton decides to make his own, since good corned beef is hard to find outside of the Big Apple and certainly south of the Mason-Dixon. Along the way, the history of the succulent meat and the myth of the St. Patrick's Day traditional meal.

Recipes

- Corned beef brisket

- Corned beef and cabbage

- Corned beef hash

episodes.name: Espress Yourself
episodes.overview:
Put down the Venti mocha soy latte and step away from the Starbucks slowly. Alton gets back to basics with the tiny cup of brew that started it all. From the perfect bean to buying a grinder and an espresso machine, learn where you should spend your money.

Recipes featured in this episode:

- Espresso

- Macchiato 

- Cappuccino 

- Latte

episodes.name: American Classics I: Spinach Salad
episodes.overview:
Alton begins a new series focusing on the basic but often neglected simple fare of America. First up is the spinach salad. Popeye's favorite vegetable needs only a few additions to become a top-notch salad. Also, salad spinners to make your head spin.

Recipes in this episode: 

- Wilted spinach salad with bacon dressing 

- Cold spinach salad with bacon and egg dressing

episodes.name: Milk Made
episodes.overview: Only one naturally occurring edible substance exists only as food  milk. Even honey, technically a manufactured product, does not qualify. Alton spends some time discussing the production and history of milk as well as some things to watch out for (featuring a surprise guest). Recipes include: Tres Leche Cake, Dolce de Leche, & Quick Cottage Cheese.

episodes.name: Pretzel Logic
episodes.overview:
The pretzel, once a delicious treat, has sadly been twisted into the edible equivalent of cardboard. Alton Brown recreates the traditional soft pretzel in all its crisp, chewy, golden brown glory.

Recipes:

 Homemade Soft Pretzels

 Homemade Hard Pretzels

 Best Mustard Ever

episodes.name: Coconut Cake Revival
episodes.overview:
Is it possible to make great cake with coconut from a can? Should you even try? Host Alton Brown wants to know and he's willing to crack open as many nuts as it takes to make a slice of paradise on a plate.

Recipes:

 Coconut Cake with 7-Minute Frosting

 Coconut Milk and Cream

 Coconut Extract

episodes.name: Sub Standards
episodes.overview:
Whether filling in for your French teacher or your favorite spice, substitutes can be every bit as successful as the original. Join host Alton Brown and a handful of substitute chefs as they take on a few good recipes with one ingredient tied behind their backs.

Recipes:

 The Chewy Gluten Free

 Southern Biscuits

 Faux Peanut Sauce

episodes.name: Fishing Whole
episodes.overview:
Scales, tails and eyes oh my! Who's afraid of whole fish? Not Alton Brown. Confront your fishy phobias head on with the fearless host as he roasts, planks and fries up a few good (whole) fish.

Recipes:

 Pan-Fried Smelts

 Plank Grilled Whole Trout

 Whole Striped Bass

episodes.name: Whithering Bites
episodes.overview:
Dried fruit may not be glamorous, but what it lacks in fashion it more than makes up for in flavor and versatility.

Recipes:

 Dried Fruit

 Individual Fruit Compote Pies

 Sweet Dried Fruit Compote

 Trail Mix

episodes.name: Stew Romance
episodes.overview:
If great stew, like great music, is a commingling of ingredients to create culinary harmony, why do so many stews taste less like beautiful music and more like a murky dirge?

Recipes:

 Good Eats Beef Stew

episodes.name: Dill-icious
episodes.overview:
Join host Alton Brown as he helps a humble cucumber fulfill its culinary destiny of becoming a pickle.

Recipes:

Deep-Fried Pickles

Dill Pickles

episodes.name: Peanut Gallery
episodes.overview:
A little ghostly inspiration is all Alton Brown needs to turn a handful of peanuts into some seriously good eats.

Recipes:  

 Boiled Peanuts 

 Boiled Peanut Soup 

 Roasted Peanuts 

 Homemade Peanut Butter 

 Peanut Butter Pie

episodes.name: Bean Stalker
episodes.overview:
Join Food Network's intrepid host, Alton Brown, as he reinvents the classic green bean casserole just in time to save the holidays.

Recipes:  

Best Ever Green Bean Casserole

episodes.name: Kinda Blue (Blueberry)
episodes.overview:
Join host Alton Brown as he reveals the secret to turning this summer's superstar, the blueberry, into a year-round treat.

Recipes

 Blueberry Buckle

 Frozen Blueberry Pie

 Blueberry Soda

episodes.name: Puff the Magic Mallow
episodes.overview: From their swampy origins to modern machine molds, host Alton Brown shares the sweet, sticky science behind homemade marshmallow. Recipes include: Homemade Marshmallows, Ambrosia.

episodes.name: American Slicer
episodes.overview: Alton dedicates a show to the tools of the trade, cutlery. In it he discusses the three types of cutting techniques and the blade that best suits each. He also show the similarity between salsa and gazpacho.

episodes.name: The Wing and I
episodes.overview:
The Wing's the thing as Alton Brown prepares America's most ubiquitous of bar foods: Buffalo chicken wings.

Recipes:

 Orange Glazed Chicken Wings

 Buffalo Wings

episodes.name: Apple of My Pie
episodes.overview:
An American classic is revisited when host Alton Brown makes everybody's favorite, apple pie.

Recipes:

 Super Apple Pie

episodes.name: If It Ain't Broccoli, Don't Fix It
episodes.overview:
It may be the bane of children and presidents but broccoli is a nutritional superfood. Join host Alton Brown as he transforms broccoli from limp and bitter to crisp and delicious.

Recipes:

 Fresh Broccoli Salad

 Pan Steamed Broccoli

 Oven Roasted Broccoli

episodes.name: The Alton Crown Affair
episodes.overview:
Host Alton Brown proves that Crown Roast of Lamb can be a dish to shock and awe without needlessly intimidating any cook who attempts to prepare it.

Recipes:

 Crown Roast of Lamb

episodes.name: Cran Opening
episodes.overview:
Host Alton Brown takes us from the bog to the bar

as he explores the many uses of that all-American

super fruit, the cranberry.

Note: The episode was taped during the Cranberry season (September -  October) of 2007. By the time it was edited in 2008, Food Network decided to hold it until the Thanksgiving season in the US even though it was the last episode of Season 11 and Season 12 was already beginning to air. It did, however air in Canada on 5-26-2008.

episodes.name: Honey, I Shrunk the Cake
episodes.overview:
Join host Alton Brown as he breaks the trend toward an overly sweet and fussy pastry and gets us back to the original chiffon cupcake that will make you feel like a kid again. 

Recipes:  

 Chiffon Cupcakes 

 Chocolate Chiffon Cupcake

episodes.name: Going Dutch
episodes.overview:
The power might be out but that doesn't stop host Alton Brown from breaking out the cast iron and using his hearth and his grill to whip up some very good eats.

Recipes : 

 Knead Not Sourdough 

 Dutch Oven Cherry Clafouti 

 Dutch Oven Hoecakes

episodes.name: Popover Sometime
episodes.overview:
Armed with one simple yet versatile recipe, host Alton Brown creates a variety of dishes from a breakfast treat to that dinner classic, Yorkshire pudding.

Recipes: Dutch Baby, Yorkshire Pudding with Roast, Basic Popover

episodes.name: Celeryman
episodes.overview:
Celeryman

Celery is not just for peanut butter anymore as host Alton Brown explores the only common plant that can be used as a vegetable, a starch, an herb and a spice.

episodes.name: Tuna, Surprise!
episodes.overview: An animated icon visits host Alton Brown and challenges him to raise the bar on canned tuna beyond the usual casserole or tuna salad sandwich.

episodes.name: There Will Be Oil
episodes.overview: Alton puts cooking oils to use in the kitchen as well as the car.

episodes.name: Frozen Cache
episodes.overview: Alton shows how the freezer can be used for proper food preservation.

episodes.name: Oh My, Meat Pie
episodes.overview: Join host Alton Brown as he tells the tale of an ancestor's journey to the New World by way of a curious meat pie shop. He explores the origins and preparation of Shepherd's Pie and Mincemeat Pie.

episodes.name: Et Tu, Mame
episodes.overview: Alton uses the soy bean in a various recipes.

episodes.name: Flat Is Beautiful IV: Going Crackers
episodes.overview: In this fourth Flat is Beautiful episode, Alton shows his audience how to create a variety of crackers at home, including graham crackers.

episodes.name: American Classics III: Creole in a Bowl
episodes.overview: Alton explores the cultural and historical influences on the New Orleans classic, beans and rice.

episodes.name: Switched on Baklava
episodes.overview: Phyllo dough can be finicky but host Alton Brown tames this difficult pastry to create that wonderfully layered dessert known as baklava.

episodes.name: Ginger: Rise of the Rhizome
episodes.overview: Alton explores various sweet uses of the spice, ginger.

episodes.name: A Cabbage Sprouts in Brussels
episodes.overview: Alton deals with the dreaded Brussells Sprout.

episodes.name: Orange Aid
episodes.overview: Alton uses oranges to create a classic drink, a topping, and a creamy cold dessert.

episodes.name: Pantry Raid X: Dark Side of the Cane
episodes.overview: Alton cooks with molasses.

episodes.name: Gills Gone Wild
episodes.overview: Alton shows how properly and simply prepared wild salmon is worth the extra cost.

episodes.name: Crustacean Nation IV: Crawfish
episodes.overview: Host Alton Brown explores a bayou staple, the delicious and sustainable alternative to lobster, the crawfish.

episodes.name: Tamale Never Dies
episodes.overview: Quite possibly the original convenience food, tamales are ancient and delicious. Join host Alton Brown on an historical and tasty exploration of these tempting treats.

episodes.name: American Classics IV: Spaghetti With Meat Sauce
episodes.overview: Although usually considered an Italian dish, spaghetti with meat sauce proves to be an American classic as host Alton Brown explores its origins.

episodes.name: Tender Is the Pork
episodes.overview: Looking for an alternative to chicken? Host Alton Brown turns to the pork tenderloin as a delicious yet low fat substitute for the ubiquitous bird.

episodes.name: Undercover Veggies I
episodes.overview: In an effort to tempt his niece into eating her vegetables, host Alton Brown manages to sneak them into several tasty treats.

episodes.name: Feeling Punchy
episodes.overview: Despite its long and noble history, punch rarely receives the respect it deserves so host Alton Brown begins a quest to return the drink to its rightful culinary position.

episodes.name: Another Man Food Show: Breakfast
episodes.overview: Host Alton Brown helps an average Joe overcome his kitchen phobias and whip up the classic breakfast of bacon, eggs and coffee.

episodes.name: Fermentation Nation
episodes.overview: Most people think of beer and wine only as drinks, but host Alton Brown thinks outside the bottle as he uses them as key ingredients in several tasty dishes.

episodes.name: American Classics V: A Pound of Cake
episodes.overview: The pound cake may have been born in Britain but host Alton Brown considers it to be an American classic. Join him as he explores the history and preparation of this delicious treat.

episodes.name: The Once and Future Fish
episodes.overview: Concerned about the impact of over-fishing, host Alton Brown explores tasty and extremely sustainable farm-raised trout.

episodes.name: Pantry Raid XII: Turning Japanese
episodes.overview: The ingredients for that beguiling Japanese concoction, miso soup, may seem a bit unusual until host Alton Brown demystifies them and explores the wonders of the Japanese pantry.

episodes.name: The Proof Is in the Pudding
episodes.overview: Host Alton Brown breaks into the liquor cabinet, not to concoct a drink but to examine the uses of alcohol in food preparation.

episodes.name: Live and Let Diet
episodes.overview: Alton discusses the eating plan that helped him lose 50 pounds.

episodes.name: Raising the Bar Again
episodes.overview: Join Alton Brown as he deconstructs the Margarita and Bloody Mary and reconstructs them with a classic formula Good Eats style.

episodes.name: The Ballad of Salty and Sweet
episodes.overview: Host Alton Brown examines ways to super-charge desserts with salt. Bacon praline anyone?

episodes.name: American Classics VII: Don't Be Chicken of Dumplings
episodes.overview: Host Alton Brown takes on the classic American soup that divides the country, and his family.

episodes.name: The Curious Case of Curry
episodes.overview: Alton Brown attempts to set the record straight on the English dish that made India famous.

episodes.name: The Catfish Will Rise Again
episodes.overview: After confessing a long-lived love for catfish, host Alton Brown sets out to modernize its image.

episodes.name: It's a Pan, It's a Dish, It's Paella
episodes.overview: Host Alton Brown demystifies the Spanish pan and the rice dish it's famous for.

episodes.name: Porterhouse Rules
episodes.overview: Learn everything you need to know about this legendary cut-o-cow to produce steak house standard results for a hundred bucks under steak house prices.

episodes.name: Grillus Domesticus
episodes.overview: If you own a grill, sooner or later you're going to put some chicken on it...it's inevitable. And odds are good you won't be happy with the results, unless of course you watch this show.

episodes.name: Age of Asparagus
episodes.overview: Everything you never knew you wanted to know about procuring, preserving, and presenting the first vegetable of the season: asparagus. Buying, storing, and cooking are investigated as well as the science behind that...um...funny smell.

episodes.name: Little Big Lunch: Eggs Benedict
episodes.overview: When it comes to brunch, Eggs Benedict is king. Problem is, it usually isn't good eats. Host Alton Brown tears down the dish and rebuilds from the ground up.

episodes.name: Flat is Beautiful V
episodes.overview: Thin and crispy artisanal wood fired pizzas are nearly impossible to manage at home but with some sound science and a good grill, you can come close to perfection.

episodes.name: Yes We Have No Banana Pudding
episodes.overview: Whether you like them cool and cream topped or warm with a crown of meringue, odds are if you're a banana pudding fan it's been a long time since you smiled. That's all about to change.

episodes.name: American Classics VIII: Tacos
episodes.overview: They may have been born in Mexico but today the taco is a concept as "American" as apple pie. Host Alton Brown seeks to refurbish 2 particularly tarnished variations on the theme.

episodes.name: Fry Hard III: Fry, Tempura, Fry!
episodes.overview: Host Alton Brown takes on the most mythic, magical, but often times monstrous form of frying known to modern man.

episodes.name: Oat Cuisine II
episodes.overview: Host Alton Brown helps you get more oats in your diet with some very surprising culinary incarnations.

episodes.name: All Hallows Eats
episodes.overview: Host Alton Brown decides to put the "trick" into his treats with three sinister twists on classic Halloween candies.

episodes.name: Squash Court II
episodes.overview: Host Alton Brown deals deliciously with a surprising glut of summer squash.

episodes.name: American Classic IX: Pumpkin Pie
episodes.overview: Host Alton Brown delves into the Fall Classic taking it back to Plymouth and forward to the future.

episodes.name: Egg Files VII: Meringue
episodes.overview: Alton takes an in-depth look at three classic meringue-based desserts, including Baked Alaska, a time-honored favorite in households across the United States.

episodes.name: Pantry Raid XIII: Destination Chickpea
episodes.overview:
International travel is a risky, uncomfortable, and expensive business these days but if you have dry chickpeas in your pantry, exotic destinations are easily reached from the comfort of your kitchen. Join host Alton Brown as he journeys to the near east with hummus and falafel.

Recipes in This Episode

-----------------------------

Falafel

Hummus For Real

Pressure Cooker Chickpeas

Roasted Chickpeas

Slow Cooker Chickpeas

episodes.name: Devil Of A Cake
episodes.overview: Do you have to tangle with dark forces in order to create a quality Devil's Food Cake or its crimson kin, Red Velvet? Yes you do. And it's called cocoa powder. Join host Alton Brown as he reinvents the classics.

episodes.name: A Bird In The Pie Is Worth Two In The Bush
episodes.overview: Chicken Pot Pie is a medieval classic that's fallen into disrepair recently, due in large part to our willingness to let factories do the baking for us. Join host Alton Brown as he looks at three different ways to fix this sad state.

episodes.name: Use Your Noodle IV: Lasagna
episodes.overview: If lasagna (the noodle) is the most comforting ingredient of all time (and it is) then lasagna (the casserole) must be the most comforting dish of all time. Problem is, most American lasagnas deliver more consternation than comfort. Join host Alton Brown as he puts lasagna back in its place.

episodes.name: Waiter There's A Fish In My Soup
episodes.overview: Bouillabaisse may be a scary name, but the soup it represents doesn't have to be. In fact, if you're willing to buy some decent fish and master a few basics, it can most definitely qualify as Good Eats.

episodes.name: The Proof is in the Bread Pudding
episodes.overview: Host Alton Brown uses a scientific secret formula in an attempt to devise the definitive bread pudding.

episodes.name: Roll Call
episodes.overview: Host Alton Brown harnesses the power of yeast to put classic rolls back onto the American dinner table.

episodes.name: The Caul of the Flower
episodes.overview: Host Alton Brown makes amends for having insulted the odd ball of the cabbage family: cauliflower.

episodes.name: Use Your Noodle 5
episodes.overview: Host Alton Brown investigates the culinary possibilities of Asian Noodles. Dishes include "ants climbing trees".

episodes.name: American Classics X: Chicken Parm
episodes.overview: Alton Brown makes the argument that Italian food was actually invented in America, and that Chicken Parmesan is the dish where it all began. Yet, an Italian canned tomato makes it all possible.

episodes.name: Every Grain Old Is New Again
episodes.overview: Ancient American grains like amaranth, chia and quinoa are making a comeback due to their versatility and nutritional content. Alton Brown shows how to make the most of these very old kitchen newcomers.

episodes.name: Hittin' the Sauce II
episodes.overview: No matter how good of a cook you are, sooner or later your seafood is going to let you down. Alton Brown has the sauces that will save your dinner every time.

episodes.name: Immersion Therapy
episodes.overview: The last decade has seen a lot of change in the food world, but no device has made more of a difference than the immersion circulator. Alton Brown makes an argument for having one in every kitchen by featuring dishes such as perfect rump roast, cheesecake and a killer liqueur.

episodes.name: My Shakshuka
episodes.overview: Alton Brown takes a deep dive on one of the most internet-famous dishes of the decade by way of a famous film from the 1940s. Along the way, Alton talks through preserved lemons and homemade harissa.

episodes.name: Let Them Eat Icebox Cake
episodes.overview: Alton Brown resuscitates the languishing tradition of the "icebox" or "refrigerator" cake. These no-bake cakes were all the rage in the 1950s, but theyre ready for a pastry redux.

episodes.name: Rich Little Poor Boy
episodes.overview: One of America's most storied sandwiches gets a historic rethink and a technical do-over, from the oysters to the bread and everything in between. Alton Brown also makes an argument for shucking.

episodes.name: Raw Ambition
episodes.overview: Alton Brown journeys through the history and science of the greatest of all raw meat dishes: steak tartare. But first, you have to promise to never make it. Right? Right. Oh, and there's poke too!

episodes.name: Date Tripper
episodes.overview: Alton Brown tells everything you need to know to get dates into your culinary life, including three recipes for the 1960s classic Devils on Horseback and a very scrummy Sticky Toffee Pudding.

episodes.name: Wild Yeast Risin'
episodes.overview: First the pandemic, then the zombies, then the nukes and now: desolation and a giant dinosaur-thing. Luckily there are still plenty of yeast in the air, and Alton Brown proves that with a wild sourdough in the kitchen, the post-apocalyptic world can still taste good -- and he makes cheese crackers and waffles to prove it.

episodes.name: The Turkey Strikes Back
episodes.overview: Alton Brown shares three turkey recipes to make year-round.

episodes.name: Holiday Spirits
episodes.overview: Alton shares the low-alcohol, flavorful secret to handling the holidays

episodes.name: Whole Latke Love
episodes.overview: Alton Brown delves into the history and techniques of making latkes.

episodes.name: Marrow Minded
episodes.overview: Alton tackles bone marrow and delivers everything you need to know to enjoy Gods butter at home.

episodes.name: In Cold Brew
episodes.overview: Alton opens all-new dimensions of coffee enjoyment with an exploration of cold brew  and no, iced coffee isnt the same thing

episodes.name: Fry Bread, Fry
episodes.overview: Not all great breads come from the oven. Host Alton Brown takes on two very different fried breads, each with a twist.

episodes.name: Immersion: Gone Fishing
episodes.overview: The best way to cook fish: Put it back in the water ... in a bag!

episodes.name: Bibimbap 'Till Ya Drop
episodes.overview: Alton takes on bibimbap, the famed "mixed rice" dish of Korea.

episodes.name: Deep Sea Green
episodes.overview: Alton delves into dried seaweeds and why they should be in your pantry.

episodes.name: Bagel Attraction
episodes.overview: Host Alton Brown dives into the history, science and technique of making "real" bagels at home.

episodes.name: Fermentation Man
episodes.overview: When civilization crumbles, who ya gonna call to help get good eats on the table? Lactic acid bacteria, of course.
